Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Thorac519
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at the Bristol in Mexico City and think it is excellent value. The staff are eager to please (some English spoken), the restaurant food is good, and the rooms comfortable. The location is great, close to Reforma, the British and US Embassies, and the area is well patrolled by police cars.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashion, intimate, cozy”
Reviews.Author: TimeTravellerMX
Reviews.Content: Close to Reforma and U.S. Embassy you will find this timeless spot. Very happy people is ready to serve you and also a great place to have like "home made" meals. Don't expect luxury, this is well located calm place.

Reviews.Title: “Far too expensive, max. 2 Star standard”
Reviews.Author: elkarl
Reviews.Content: We had to pay nearly 90 USD for a double without breakfast so we expected at least a 4 Star hotel! No way, this Hotel looks (and smells) like it hasn't seen any remodelation for the last 30 years. Dark hallways without any window, incredibly dusty aircon, walls as thin you can hear the snorring from both bedrooms next to you, and the worst: the mattrasses are so old, the steel-springs are torturing you the whole night through!!! There are by far better Hotels within this area for at least 20$ less including breakfst and internet! Oh, did I mention that they charge you extra for using the Internet?!? YES they do! So: if you get a Double for 50USD it might be OK, but every dollar more is waisting Money! Better check out the nearby Hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Great value & wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: QueenBee0301
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the Reforma near the Monument of the Angel. Rooms are fine; food in hotel is good; plenty of activity in area; area seems to be quite safe; price is right! What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: ee_sundevil
Reviews.Content: I won't stay anywhere else in Mexico City, ever! This is perhaps the best value in town. 2 blocks from Reforma and the American Embassy, close to public transportation, only a few miles away from the Zocalo and the Templo Mayor, you won't find a better hotel! The food was great, and the staff remembered me from my prior stays there (May and November of last year.) There are indeed some issues with their wireless connection but the desktops at the lobby are fast and efficient. The night staff always took great care of me, and the night phone operator, Eduardo, is fluent in English, French and German, and is extremely knowledgeable of the city and its surroundings. Don't look any further- stay at the Bristol!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't suggest this to anyone”
Reviews.Author: lozziep
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks for business. The service and food in the restaurant was way below standard for the prices, although I found the room service waiter very polite and attentive. Every morning a housekeeper barged into my room wanting to know if I had any cleaning, without waiting for me to open the door myself. The person who cleaned my room more often than not took all of my items from where I had left them for my convenience and left them in different places. One day they re-arranged the way I had hung my clothes in the closet! Things that were clearly not rubbish were thrown away. The walls in the room were paper thin, to the extent that one night I needed to telephone the guest next door and ask them to turn down their television so I could sleep. The beds were tiny, masquerading as doubles, but really only single beds. Also, mattresses about as comfortable as sleeping on the floor and no extra blankets provided. They advertise wireless internet, but it there is a cost involved, and it is very unreliable which is not what I expect from a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Seems to be a really nice hotel, for the $$”
Reviews.Author: kimanjo
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I did NOT stay at this hotel. I was staying 1.5 blocks away at the Casa Gonzales, a budget hotel/pensione in the $60 range. Great cheap little restuarant acorss the plaza called El Mister. However, my daughter and I did walk by the hotel (a beautiful little outdoor cafe area) and we were very impressed. As a matter of fact, my daughter asked why we weren't staying at the Hotel Bristol, which appeared to be more "together". Although Casa Gonzalez is quaint--nice floral courtyard--the rooms are very inconsistant and some have an incredible amount of black mould on the bathroom ceilings (and I am tolerant of mold in bathrooms, living in Florida and used to the problems of high humidity). For the same price, during our next stay in Mexico City we will stay at the Hotel Bristol.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccalles
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bristol is definitely a good option for business executives, families or just anyone with a 50 dollar per night budget. My girlfriend and I stayed at the Bristol two nights on February 2007. The employees treated us very well, room service was fine, although one of the nights, it took them over half an hour to bring the meal up to the room, then the waiter tried to keep one dollar extra of our change claiming a "mistake"... But we reported this to the people at the front desk and they said they would talk to the waiter. I am almost sure that it was an isolated case, though, because other members of my family have stayed there and they never had a problem like that before. Everything else was great. They have a pretty good restaurant with plenty of Mexican dishes, and the service was excellent. It was a pleasant stay, except for that little detail with the room service waiter.

Reviews.Title: “Under rated hotel at Mexico City.”
Reviews.Author: PurÃ©pecha
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the most under rated hotels in Mexico City. It is very well located, two blocks from American Embassy and one block away from British Embassy. It is two blocks from the Mexican Stock Exchange and just across Reforma Avenue there is the Zona Rosa (chic neighborhood for lunch and gay and semi red light district by nights). Nevertheless the hotel is located at a very quiet and safe street. Rates are cheap and the services are good. The food is also very good. This is my first option every time I travel to Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bristol is a great place to stay in Mexico City, near Zona ROSA, convenient stores close by, close to Reforma. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great end of trip experience!”
Reviews.Author: dk0815
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bristol is a clean, centrally located, friendly hotel. The rooms were very clean, updated and comfortable. The bathrooms were also of the same standard. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel is located just off of Reforma pretty close to the Zona Rosa. We were able to walk wherever we needed and felt very safe - the hotel sits a block or so from the British and American embassies. The price is also quite reasonable, but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Bristol's an old favourite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Bristol on and off for twenty years. I think it offers very good value considering its excellent location. One block from Reforma Avenue and the Zona Rosa, and one block from the US and British Embassies. The rooms are very large and clean and the bathrooms perfectly adequate. The staff are friendly and it has the air of a family hotel. The restaurant/coffee shop is adequate but no more than that. General clientele is Mexican attending conferences and I've never heard any rowdyness. The business centre is modest, but you can send e-mails and get on the web OK. There's no gym or swimming pool but then, what do you expect for US$60?
